sense.def:
To work
pomeni opravljati službo, za katero smo plačani.

seg.quote: He was working in a bank.
Some of my salesmen formerly worked for a rival firm.

sense.def:
To have work
ali
to be in work
pomeni imeti službo.

seg.quote: ...people who can't find work.
...the numbers out of work.

sense.def:
To work
pomeni opravljati naloge, ki jih zahteva naša služba, ali nalogo, ki jo je treba opraviti.

seg.quote: I watched the people working at the weaving looms.
She works hard at keeping herself fit.
He has been working all season on his game.
I used to work a ten-hour day.

sense.def:
Work
so tudi naloge, ki jih zahteva naša služba, ali katerekoli naloge, ki jih je treba opraviti.

seg.quote: I've got some work to do.
I finish work at 3.
A housewife's work can take ten or twelve hours a day.

sense.def:
Tudi tisto, kar je posledica neke dejavnosti, službe ali področja raziskav, imenujemo
work
.

seg.quote: That's an absolutely fascinating piece of work.
There has been considerable work done in America on this subject.

sense.def:
To work the land
pomeni obdelovati zemljo.

seg.quote: ...peasants working the land.

sense.def:
To work a machine or piece of equipment
pomeni uporabljati ali nadzorovati stroj ali del opreme.

seg.quote: ...the boy who worked the milking machine.

sense.def:
Kadar stroj ali del opreme
works
, deluje in opravlja svoje naloge.

seg.quote: The traffic lights weren't working properly.

sense.def:
Kadar neka zamisel, metoda ali sistem
works
, je uspešen.

seg.quote: That kind of democracy will never work.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
works against someone
, nekomu povzroča težave. Kadar nekaj
works in someone's favour
, nekomu pomaga.

seg.quote: The apathy of the opposition is working in his favour.

sense.def:
To work on an assumption or idea
pomeni odločati se na podlagi neke domneve ali zamisli.

Kadar nekaj
works into a particular position
, se postopoma premika v določeni položaj.

seg.quote: The ropes had worked loose.

sense.def:
To work one's way somewhere
pomeni s težavo se nekam premakniti.

cit.quote: s težavo napredovati, utirati si pot

seg.quote: I worked my way slowly out of the marsh.

sense.def:
A work
je neka stvaritev, na primer umetniška slika, knjiga ali skladba.

seg.quote: ...a large volume containing all of Chopin's works.
...the collected works of Proust.

sense.def:
A works
je kraj, kjer nekaj izdelujejo z industrijskim postopkom.

seg.quote: ...the gas works.

sense.def:
To have one's work cut out to do something
pomeni, da nekaj zelo težko delamo.

seg.quote: We'll have our work cut out to finish on time.
The delivery men are working to rule.

sense.def:
To work oneself into a state of being upset or angry
pomeni pripraviti se do tega, da postanemo vznemirjeni ali jezni.

seg.quote: She worked herself into a rage.

sense.def:
To work off a feeling
pomeni premagati neko čustvo, tako da počnemo nekaj silovitega ali nasilnega.

seg.quote: We should all be able to work off our stress physically.

sense.def:
To work out a solution to a problem or mystery
pomeni priti do rešitve nekega problema ali skrivnosti.

seg.quote: We are always hoping that a more peaceful solution can be worked out.
Now you can work out the area of the triangle.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
works out at a particular amount
, je preračunano tolikšen znesek.

seg.quote: Petrol prices here work out at around £1.15 a gallon.

sense.def:
Kadar določene okoliščine
work out in a particular way
, nastanejo ali se razvijajo na tak način.

seg.quote: It's funny how life worked out.
Things worked out well with Marian.

sense.def:
To work out
pomeni delati telovadne vaje, da bi bilo naše telo v kondiciji in močno.

seg.quote: She worked out in a ballet class three hours a week.

sense.def:
To work oneself up
pomeni postopoma postati zelo vznemirjen ali jezen zaradi nečesa.

seg.quote: She worked herself up into a frenzy.

sense.def:
To work up a feeling
pomeni postopoma začutiti določeno čustvo.

seg.quote: I can hardly work up enough energy to go to the shops.
She went for a run to work up an appetite.

sense.def:
To work up to a particular amount or level
pomeni postopoma povečati ali izboljšati tisto, kar počnemo, dokler ne dosežemo določene količine ali ravni.

seg.quote: Start slowly and work up to a faster time.
